jade.core
Class Actor

java.lang.Object
  jade.core.Messenger
      jade.core.Actor

public abstract class Actor
extends Messenger

Represents anything on a Jade World that can perform an action (or be acted upon). This obviously includes things like the player, NPCs, and monsters. Not as obviously, an Actor can represent things like items, spells, doors and traps, or even abstract actions like timers and events. An Actor can be attached to one another in order to create other interesting effects. For example, an enchantment spell might be an effect Actor attached to an item Actor. A timer Actor could be attached to the spell which simple counts an appropriate amount of turns, then expires the spell Actor.

Constructor Detail

Actor

public Actor(ColoredChar face)
Constructs a new Actor with the given face.

Parameters:
face - the face of the Actor
Method Detail

act

public abstract void act()
Performs the actions of this Actor. Normally this would be called by the World in the tick() method, which allows the Actor actions to be scheduled properly based on act order and Actor speed.

attach

public void attach(Actor holder)
Attaches this Actor to another. Note that the Actor must not be currently held or bound to a World when calling this method. The position of this Actor will follow the holder, and the Actor will be bound to the holder's World. However, the Actor will not be placed on the World grid and will therefore not be accessible through world.getActorAt() or world.getActorsAt().

Parameters:
holder - the new holder of the Actor

bound

public final boolean bound()
Returns true if the Actor bound to a World. This is equivalent to calling actor.world() != null.

Returns:
true if the Actor bound to a World

bound

public final boolean bound(World world)
Returns true if the Actor is bound to the given World. This is equivalent to calling actor.world() == world.

Parameters:
world - the World being tested
Returns:
true if the Actor is bound to world

detach

public void detach()
Detaches this Actor from its current holder. Note that the Actor must currently be held when calling this method. If the Actor is bound, it will be placed on the World at the current position of the holder.

expire

public void expire()
Expires the Actor, or in other words, marks it for removal.

expired

public boolean expired()
Returns true if the Actor is expired, or in other words, marked for removal.

Returns:
true if the Actor is expired

Returns the face of the Actor.

Returns:
the face of the Actor

held

public final boolean held()
Returns true if the Actor is currently held. This is equivalent to actor.holder() != null.

Returns:
true if the Actor is currently held

held

public final boolean held(Actor holder)
Returns true if the Actor is held by the specified Actor. This is equivalent to actor.holder() == holder.

Parameters:
holder - the holder being tested
Returns:
true if the Actor is held by the specified holder

setPos

public final void setPos(Coordinate coord)
Sets the position of the Actor on its current World. The Actor must be bound and not held when this method is called.

Parameters:
coord - the new position of the Actor
